Uncanny Dodge (Dire Bunny).name: Uncanny Dodge (Dire Bunny)
Uncanny Dodge (Dire Bunny).description:
Prerequisite: 9th-level tamer

Type: Active (reaction)

When an attacker that the dire bunny can see hits it with an attack, the dire bunny can use its reaction to halve the attack’s damage against it.

The Greatsword out of the Stone (Legenda.name: The Greatsword out of the Stone (Legendary)
The Greatsword out of the Stone (Legenda.description:
Weapon, legendary (requires attunement by a creature with a Strength of 16 or higher)
Component: aberration (bonemonger) brain
Martial weapon, melee weapon 6 lb.
Properties. Heavy, Two-Handed

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach [[lookup @item.range.reach]] ft. , one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

The Lady of the Lake, her arm clad in the purest shimmering samite, once bestowed a blade just like this one unto the rightful ruler of the land, that he might wield it in defence of the downtrodden and oppressed. This replica is just as good as the real thing... but its craftsman seems to have forgotten a tiny little detail.

This sword, deals an extra [[/damage 1d6 radiant average]] damage to each target it hits.

Supreme Executive Power. As the owner of the mighty sword, you command respect and obedience beyond compare, and no authority is higher than yours. While carrying the sword, you have &reference[advantage]{advantage} on Charisma (Persuasion) checks, Charisma saving throws, and saving throws made against spells of the Enchantment school of magic.

Conjure Watery Tart. While holding this sword, you can cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.1LkZvINag7KqBmDR]{Conjure Elemental} spell (water elemental only). The elemental takes the shape of an elegant woman, and if your concentration on the spell is broken, it doesn't turn hostile toward you and your companions, but instead spends the remainder of the spell's duration following and berating you for perceived misuses of power. Once this property of the sword has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

Heavy. Creatures that are Small or Tiny have disadvantage on attack rolls with heavy weapons. A heavy weapon's size and bulk make it too large for a Small or Tiny creature to use effectively.

Two-Handed. This weapon requires two hands to use. This property is relevant only when you attack with the weapon, not when you simply hold it.

Grasping Bonetide I (Dire Bunny).name: Grasping Bonetide I (Dire Bunny)
Grasping Bonetide I (Dire Bunny).description:
Prerequisite: 5th-level tamer

Type: Active (action)

As an action, the dire bunny summons a wave of animated bones that ripples out from it in either a 30-foot cone or 15-foot-radius circle (dire bunny’s choice). Skeletal limbs burst out from surfaces in the area, slashing and grasping at creatures in contact with those surfaces. Each of those creatures must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) slashing damage and becoming restrained until the end of the dire bunny’s next turn on a failure, or taking half as much damage and not becoming restrained on a success. After the dire bunny uses this action, it can’t do so again until its tamer finishes a short or long rest.

When the dire bunny’s tamer reaches 9th level in the tamer class, the damage of this action increases to 17 (5d6).

Osseous Spike (Very Rare).name: Osseous Spike (Very Rare)
Osseous Spike (Very Rare).description:
Weapon (@Compendium[dnd5e.items.RnuxdHUAIgxccVwj]{Lance}), very rare (requires attunement)
Component: aberration (bonemonger) bone

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach [[lookup @item.range.reach]] ft. , one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

The essence of the malicious Bonemonger always hungers for more victims, and this craving persists even after death. Those who hold this jagged lance can feel its insatiable desire to be bathed in blood, and see shadowy claws crawl across its surface when it has gone too long without...

This lance has 4 charges and regains [[/r 1d4]] expended charges daily at dawn.

Syphoning Splinters. When you hit a creature with an attack using this lance, you can expend 1 charge to cause the tip of the lance to explode into sharp splinters; the creature must make a [[/save format=long]]. On a failed save, the creature takes [[/damage activity=6IdnmoiXynSHuXbP average]] damage and some of the splinters are embedded inside of it for 1 minute. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and suffers no additional effects. A creature with splinters inside of it takes [[/damage activity=h3WtfWo848xXvExG average]] damage at the end of each of its turns, and you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt this way as the splinters syphon the victim's vitality into you. A creature with splinters inside it or another creature within 5 feet of it can use an action to make a [[/check medicine 16 format=long]], removing the splinters on a success.

Crippling Impalement. As an action while holding this lance, you can cause its shadowy hands to extend and try to grab a creature that you can see within 20 feet of you, forcing it to make a [[/save activity=8seBI6JulDXBlvhi format=long]]. On a failed save, the creature is seized by the hands, pulled to within 5 feet of you, and has an arm or leg (your choice) skewered by the lance, taking [[/damage activity=8seBI6JulDXBlvhi average]] damage. The shadowy hands then release the creature. Until the end of its next turn, the creature has &reference[disadvantage]{disadvantage} on attack rolls made with the use of its arms if you skewered its arm, or has its speed reduced to 0 feet if you skewered its leg. Once this property of the lance has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

Reach. This weapon adds 5 feet to your reach when you attack with it. This property also determines your reach for opportunity attacks with a reach weapon.

Zone of Retributive Truth (Dire Bunny).name: Zone of Retributive Truth (Dire Bunny)
Zone of Retributive Truth (Dire Bunny).description:
Prerequisite: 9th-level tamer, Veracious Question

Type: Active (bonus action)

As a bonus action, the dire bunny manifests an aura that lasts for 1 minute and extends 20 feet from the dire bunny, moving with it. As part of the bonus action to create the aura and as a bonus action on subsequent turns, the dire bunny can ask one creature it can see within the aura a question. If the creature can hear (or otherwise perceive) the question and understands it, it feels compelled to answer truthfully. If it doesn’t answer before the end of its next turn, or answers untruthfully, it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be thrown up to 20 feet in a direction of the dire bunny’s choice.

After the dire bunny has manifested this aura, it can’t do so again until its tamer finishes a short or long rest.

MI! (Dire Bunny).name: MI! (Dire Bunny)
MI! (Dire Bunny).description:
Prerequisite: 3rd-level tamer

Type: Active (action)

As an action, the dire bunny proclaims “Mi!” at one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can hear the proclamation, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 4 (1d8) thunder damage and 4 (1d8) psychic damage, and become &reference[frightened] of the dire bunny until the end of the dire bunny’s next turn.

Sneak Attack (Dire Bunny).name: Sneak Attack (Dire Bunny)
Sneak Attack (Dire Bunny).description:
Prerequisite: become a tamer’s companion

Type: Passive (companion)

Once on its turn, the dire bunny can deal an extra 3 (1d6) damage to one creature it hits with a Bite attack if it has &reference[advantage]{advantage} on the attack roll. The dire bunny doesn’t need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn’t incapacitated, and the dire bunny doesn’t have disadvantage on the attack roll.

The extra damage increases by 1d6 when the dire bunny’s tamer reaches 3rd level (2d6), 5th level (3d6), 9th level (4d6), 13th level (5d6), and 17th level (6d6) in the tamer class.

Braised Berry Bunny (Rare).name: Braised Berry Bunny (Rare)
Braised Berry Bunny (Rare).description:
At any time while you are under the influence of this magical meal’s effects, you can expend 1 charge to imbue your words with the power of veracity when you ask a creature a question. The creature must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be unable to speak a deliberate lie for the next minute.

You know whether the creature succeeds or fails on its saving throw. An affected creature is aware of the spell and can thus avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive in its answers as long as it remains within the boundaries of the truth.

9WZk7DdLRTRcr1Qs.name: Uncanny Dodge (Dire Bunny)
9WZk7DdLRTRcr1Qs.description:
Prerequisite: 9th-level tamer

Type: Active (reaction)

When an attacker that the dire bunny can see hits it with an attack, the dire bunny can use its reaction to halve the attack’s damage against it.

Bone Cage (Dire Bunny).name: Bone Cage (Dire Bunny)
Bone Cage (Dire Bunny).description:
Prerequisite: 17th-level tamer, Boney Carapace II

Type: Active (action), Passive (companion)

The dire bunny gains a +1 bonus to its AC while it isn’t wearing armour. This is in addition to the bonuses from Boney Carapace I & II.

As an action, the dire bunny creates a magical effect identical to the @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.spells-heliana-hare-raising.Item.Rta3Rh4XASy8Ogaa]{bone cage} spell with a range of self (30-foot-radius sphere). After it uses this action, it can’t do so again until its tamer finishes a long rest.

Veracious Question (Dire Bunny).name: Veracious Question (Dire Bunny)
Veracious Question (Dire Bunny).description:
Prerequisite: 3rd-level tamer

Type: Active (bonus action), Passive (companion & tamer)

The dire bunny gains proficiency in the Persuasion and Intimidation skills and, while the bunny is summoned, its tamer can add half its proficiency bonus to ability checks it makes that use the Insight, Intimidation, or Persuasion skills.

In addition, when the dire bunny asks a question, it can use a bonus action to imbue the question with magical truth. If the question’s recipient can hear (or otherwise perceive) and understand the question, it must make a Charisma saving throw, blurting out a short, truthful answer on a failure, or answering as it pleases (if at all) on a success. A creature can choose to fail this saving throw. After the dire bunny has used this bonus action twice, it can’t do so again until its tamer finishes a short or long rest.

Robes of the Enchanter (Rare).name: Robes of the Enchanter (Rare)
Robes of the Enchanter (Rare).description:
Wondrous item, rare
Component: aberration (bonemonger) heart

Many scholars believe the name of this extravagant garment to be a grave misnomer, as it has no apparent relation whatsoever to enchantment magic. In truth, the robes are named after the man who devised and created the first set, a legendary sorcerer of tremendous power and curious explosive proclivities... as well as astonishing ignorance regarding the schools of magic.

Spontaneous Detonation. As an action while wearing these robes, you can wave your arms dramatically to create a small explosion at a point you can see within 30 feet of you. Each creature within 5 feet of the point must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or take [[/damage average]] damage, get pushed back 10 feet, and be knocked &reference[prone].

Explosive Step. While wearing these robes, you can cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.wqfAVANuQonNBgnL]{Misty Step} spell. When you do, you can create an explosion as per the Spontaneous Detonation property, either in the space you leave or the space you arrive at. You automatically succeed on the saving throw against it. Once this property of the robes has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

Spontaneous Detonation (Prone).name: Spontaneous Detonation (Prone)
Spontaneous Detonation (Prone).description: Each creature within 5 feet of the point must succeed on a [[/save dex 15 format=long]] or take [[/r 1d8]] fire damage, get pushed back 10 feet, and be knocked &reference[prone].

EFJ8w0UwgXkPHHck.name: Sneak Attack (Dire Bunny)
EFJ8w0UwgXkPHHck.description:
Prerequisite: become a tamer’s companion

Type: Passive (companion)

Once on its turn, the dire bunny can deal an extra 3 (1d6) damage to one creature it hits with a Bite attack if it has advantage on the attack roll. The dire bunny doesn’t need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn’t incapacitated, and the dire bunny doesn’t have disadvantage on the attack roll.

The extra damage increases by 1d6 when the dire bunny’s tamer reaches 3rd level (2d6), 5th level (3d6), 9th level (4d6), 13th level (5d6), and 17th level (6d6) in the tamer class.

Component: aberration (bonemonger) brain

Versatile. This weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property—the damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.

The Rapier out of the Stone (Legendary).description:

Finesse. When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.

The Scimitar out of the Stone (Legendary.name: The Scimitar out of the Stone (Legendary)
The Scimitar out of the Stone (Legendary.description:
Weapon, legendary (requires attunement by a creature with a Strength of 16 or higher)
Component: aberration (bonemonger) brain
Martial weapon, melee weapon 3 lb.
Properties. Finesse, Light

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach [[lookup @item.range.reach]] ft. , one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Finesse. When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.

Light. A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.

Boney Carapace I (Dire Bunny).name: Boney Carapace I (Dire Bunny)
Boney Carapace I (Dire Bunny).description:
Prerequisite: 5th-level tamer

Type: Passive (companion)

The dire bunny gains a +2 bonus to its AC while it isn’t wearing armour.

Flesh to Bone.name: Flesh to Bone
Flesh to Bone.description:
Class: Druid, Warlock, Wizard

You attempt to turn the skin of a creature you touch into bony plates. If the target’s body is made of flesh, it must make a [[/save format=long]]. A willing creature can choose to fail this saving throw. On a failure, a creature’s skin turns into hardened, articulating plates of bone. For the duration, the creature’s speed is halved, it has &reference[disadvantage]{disadvantage} on Dexterity saving throws, and it has &reference[resistance]{resistance} to piercing and slashing damage.

Grasping Bonetide II (Dire Bunny).name: Grasping Bonetide II (Dire Bunny)
Grasping Bonetide II (Dire Bunny).description:
Prerequisite: 13th-level tamer, Grasping Bonetide I

Type: Passive (companion)

The damage of the dire bunny’s Grasping Bonetide action increases to 24 (7d6), and the size of the area increases to a 50-foot cone or a 20-foot-radius circle. The dire bunny gains a +1 bonus to the save DC of this action.

When the dire bunny’s tamer reaches 17th level in the tamer class, the damage of this action increases to 35 (10d6).

Coconut of Alacrity.name: Coconut of Alacrity
Coconut of Alacrity.description:
Wondrous item, common (socketable)
Component: beast (horse) bone

The original concept for this bizarre item is said to come from a faraway land where horses are so rare that buying one is more expensive than producing low-end magical paraphernalia. When both halves of this coconut are clapped together, they produce the sound of a trotting mount and increase one's velocity to match that of an unladen swallow.

Mighty Gallop. This item can be socketed on mounts. When hung from a Small or larger creature that is serving as a mount, that creature can take the Dash action as a bonus action on its turn. Once this property of the item has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

Swallow's Velocity. Using two hands, you can hold each coconut half and clap them together repeatedly to increase your travel pace over long distances. For as long as you continue to do this, you and up to 4 friendly creatures of your choice that can hear the clapping can travel 3 miles per hour at a slow pace (27 miles per day), 4 miles per hour at a normal pace (32 miles per day), or 6 miles per hour at a fast pace (45 miles per day). The sound of the clip-clopping coconuts can be heard up to 100 feet away; other creatures within this area that can hear are alerted to the sound and can't be surprised by creatures benefitting from this magic item while it is in use.

Boney Carapace II (Dire Bunny).name: Boney Carapace II (Dire Bunny)
Boney Carapace II (Dire Bunny).description:
Prerequisite: 13th-level tamer, Boney Carapace I

Type: Passive (companion)

The dire bunny gains a +2 bonus to its AC while it isn’t wearing armour. This is in addition to the bonus from Boney Carapace I.

The Longsword in the Stone (Uncommon).name: The Longsword in the Stone (Uncommon)
The Longsword in the Stone (Uncommon).description:
Weapon, uncommon (requires attunement by a creature with a Strength of 16 or higher)
Martial weapon, melee weapon 3 lb.
Properties. Versatile ([[/r 1d10]])

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach [[lookup @item.range.reach]] ft. , one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

The Lady of the Lake, her arm clad in the purest shimmering samite, once bestowed a blade just like this one unto the rightful ruler of the land, that he might wield it in defence of the downtrodden and oppressed. This replica is just as good as the real thing... but its craftsman seems to have forgotten a tiny little detail.

This sword, which deals bludgeoning damage instead of piercing or slashing damage, deals an extra [[/damage activity=gklCVVkLZoNP2RwP average]] damage to the first target it hits on each of your turns.

Moderate Executive Power. As the owner of this mighty sword, you command respect and obedience... but the comically large boulder does detract from it a little. While carrying the sword, you have &reference[advantage]{advantage} on Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to convince others to perform tasks or favours for you.

Versatile. This weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property—the damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.

Arm of the Black Knight (Rare).name: Arm of the Black Knight (Rare)
Arm of the Black Knight (Rare).description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)
Component: undead (grey knight) bone

A shining beacon of tenacity and unwavering resolve, this amputated arm fights on with the strength of many men no matter how many times it's cut down or crushed into a pulp. Stubborn to a fault, it refuses to listen to anyone but the creature attuned to it, and occasionally makes rude gestures at passersby behind its owner's back, attempting to goad them into a fight.

Helping Hand. The arm is an object with AC 14 and 20 hit points. If it's ever more than 30 feet away from you, it moves 20 feet towards you at the start of each of your turns by crawling along the ground. As a bonus action, you can command it to move up to 20 feet and perform one of the following tasks:

  • The arm manipulates an object in the same way as the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.Utk1OQRwYkMkFRD3]{Mage Hand} cantrip.

  • The arm punches a creature within 5 feet of it, making an attack roll against it ([[/attack]] to hit) and dealing [[/damage average]] (or [[/damage activity=sSFqV6VHCKjFf4zi average]] damage if its wielding a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.10ZP2Bu3vnCuYMIB]{longsword}) damage on a hit.

  • The arm attempts to grab a creature within 5 feet of it, which must make a [[/save format=long]]. On a failed save, the arm latches on to it, reducing its speed by 20 feet if its Large or smaller. A creature can use its action to make a [[/save activity=szqqVUBj3Gq95wy9 format=long]], pulling the arm off of it or a creature within its reach on a success. The arm can't perform other tasks while holding onto a creature.

Just a Flesh Wound. If the arm is reduced to 0 hit points, it can't move or be commanded, but its remarkable resilience and regenerative abilities ensure that this doesn't last for long. The arm recovers all its hit points after [[/r 1d4]] hours. A spellcaster can also use an action to touch the arm and spend a spell slot of any level to cause the arm to recover all of its hit points.

Arm of the Black Knight (Uncommon).name: Arm of the Black Knight (Uncommon)
Arm of the Black Knight (Uncommon).description:

Component: undead (grey knight) bone

  • The arm attempts to grab a creature within 5 feet of it, which must make a [[/save format=long]]. On a failed save, the arm latches on to it, reducing its speed by 10 feet if its Large or smaller. The arm can't perform other tasks while holding onto a creature.

Just a Flesh Wound. If the arm is reduced to 0 hit points, it can't move or be commanded, but its remarkable resilience and regenerative abilities ensure that this doesn't last for long. The arm recovers all its hit points after [[/r 1d4]] hours. A spellcaster can also use an action to touch the arm and spend a spell slot of any level to cause the arm to recover all of its hit points.

Somewhat Holy Hand Grenade.name: Somewhat Holy Hand Grenade
Somewhat Holy Hand Grenade.description:
Wondrous item, very rare
Component: aberration (bonemonger) lucky paw

The Book of Armaments, an ancient holy text, speaks of a blessed weapon capable of wreaking destruction upon the evils of the world, an object so powerful that all enemies of the heavens will be blown to tiny bits, in the gods' mercy. This attempt at recreating it has been corrupted by the malicious energy of the Bonemonger... but perhaps that isn't a bad thing.

Duality of Man. As an action, you can take out the holy pin, count to three, no more, no less, and lob the grenade at a point you can see within 30 feet of you. When you do, choose one of the two options below. Whichever option you choose, the grenade is destroyed after detonating.

  • Radiant Rebuke. The grenade explodes in a burst of searing light and each creature within 20 feet of it must make a [[/save format=long]]. On a failed save, a creature takes [[/damage average]] damage. If it has an evil alignment, it takes [[/damage activity=wLpAe00oxsabLAcb average]] damage and is &reference[blinded] until the end of its next turn instead. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded.

  • Shadowy Embrace. The grenade explodes in a mess of shadowy claws and each creature within 20 feet of it must make a [[/save format=long]]. On a failed save, a creature takes [[/damage activity=oWH4iUS2l71i9801 average]] damage. If it has a non-evil alignment, it takes [[/damage activity=pl0MXpH9zKOguP6l average]] damage and is &reference[restrained] by the claws until the end of its next turn instead. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't restrained.

Radiant Rebuke (Blinded).name: Radiant Rebuke (Blinded)
Radiant Rebuke (Blinded).description: On a failed save, a creature takes [[/r 6d8]] radiant damage. If it has an evil alignment, it takes [[/r 8d8]] radiant damage and is &reference[blinded] until the end of its next turn instead.

Shadowy Embrace (restrained).name: Shadowy Embrace (restrained)
Shadowy Embrace (restrained).description: On a failed save, a creature takes [[/r 6d8]] necrotic damage. If it has a non-evil alignment, it takes [[/r 8d8]] necrotic damage and is &reference[restrained] by the claws until the end of its next turn instead. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't restrained.

Osseous Spike (Rare).name: Osseous Spike (Rare)
Osseous Spike (Rare).description:
Weapon (@Compendium[dnd5e.items.RnuxdHUAIgxccVwj]{Lance}), rare (requires attunement)
Component: aberration (bonemonger) bone

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach [[lookup @item.range.reach]] ft. , one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

The essence of the malicious Bonemonger always hungers for more victims, and this craving persists even after death. Those who hold this jagged lance can feel its insatiable desire to be bathed in blood, and see shadowy claws crawl across its surface when it has gone too long without...

This lance has 3 charges and regains [[/r 1d3]] expended charges daily at dawn.

Syphoning Splinters. When you hit a creature with an attack using this lance, you can expend 1 charge to cause the tip of the lance to explode into sharp splinters; the creature must make a [[/save format=long]]. On a failed save, the creature takes [[/damage activity=tqoKPVO76KHKITDs average]] damage and some of the splinters are embedded inside of it for 1 minute. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and suffers no additional effects. A creature with splinters inside of it takes [[/damage activity=f8a3yJ2H13twjvIf average]] damage at the end of each of its turns, and you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt this way as the splinters syphon the victim's vitality into you. A creature with splinters inside it or another creature within 5 feet of it can use an action to make a [[/check medicine 15 format=long]], removing the splinters on a success.

Reach. This weapon adds 5 feet to your reach when you attack with it. This property also determines your reach for opportunity attacks with a reach weapon.

Syphoning Splinters.name: Syphoning Splinters
Syphoning Splinters.description: A creature with splinters inside of it takes [[/r 2d4]] necrotic damage at the end of each of its turns, and you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt this way as the splinters syphon the victim's vitality into you. A creature with splinters inside it or another creature within 5 feet of it can use an action to make a [[/check wis medicine 15 format=long]], removing the splinters on a success.

Astral Enchanter III (Dire Bunny).name: Astral Enchanter III (Dire Bunny)
Astral Enchanter III (Dire Bunny).description:
Prerequisite: 17th-level tamer, Astral Enchanter II

Type: Active (action), Passive (tamer)

While the dire bunny is summoned, its tamer has a +2 bonus to Enchanting checks*. This is in addition to the bonuses from Astral Enchanter I & II.

As an action, the dire bunny can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.SleYkHovQ8NagmeV]{Locate Object} spell, requiring no material components. This spell ends early when the dire bunny is dismissed.

*See @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.journals-heliana-hare-raising.JournalEntry.14Ex7C0XPOFuBv2o.JournalEntryPage.8kbIhGW9nwAtUqQG]{Enchanting}

The Scimitar in the Stone (Uncommon).name: The Scimitar in the Stone (Uncommon)
The Scimitar in the Stone (Uncommon).description:
Weapon, uncommon (requires attunement by a creature with a Strength of 16 or higher)
Martial weapon, melee weapon 3 lb.
Properties. Finesse, Light

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach [[lookup @item.range.reach]] ft. , one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

The Lady of the Lake, her arm clad in the purest shimmering samite, once bestowed a blade just like this one unto the rightful ruler of the land, that he might wield it in defence of the downtrodden and oppressed. This replica is just as good as the real thing... but its craftsman seems to have forgotten a tiny little detail.

This sword, which deals bludgeoning damage instead of piercing or slashing damage, deals an extra [[/damage activity=PHYW52vx1uNihVLC average]] damage to the first target it hits on each of your turns.

Moderate Executive Power. As the owner of this mighty sword, you command respect and obedience... but the comically large boulder does detract from it a little. While carrying the sword, you have &reference[advantage]{advantage} on Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to convince others to perform tasks or favours for you.

Finesse. When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.

Light. A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.

Robes of the Enchanter (Uncommon).name: Robes of the Enchanter (Uncommon)
Robes of the Enchanter (Uncommon).description:
Wondrous item, uncommon
Component: aberration (bonemonger) heart

Many scholars believe the name of this extravagant garment to be a grave misnomer, as it has no apparent relation whatsoever to enchantment magic. In truth, the robes are named after the man who devised and created the first set, a legendary sorcerer of tremendous power and curious explosive proclivities... as well as astonishing ignorance regarding the schools of magic.

Spontaneous Detonation. As an action while wearing these robes, you can wave your arms dramatically to create a small explosion at a point you can see within 30 feet of you. Each creature within 5 feet of the point must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or take [[/damage average]] damage, get pushed back 10 feet, and be knocked &reference[prone].

Spontaneous Detonation (Prone).name: Spontaneous Detonation (Prone)
Spontaneous Detonation (Prone).description: Each creature within 5 feet of the point must succeed on a [[/save dex 15 format=long]] or take [[/r 1d8]] fire damage, get pushed back 10 feet, and be knocked &reference[prone].

brpFmAtSLQN7QxLC.name: Bone Cage (Dire Bunny)
brpFmAtSLQN7QxLC.description:
Prerequisite: 17th-level tamer, Boney Carapace II

Type: Active (action), Passive (companion)

The dire bunny gains a +1 bonus to its AC while it isn’t wearing armour. This is in addition to the bonuses from Boney Carapace I & II.

As an action, the dire bunny creates a magical effect identical to the @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.spells-heliana-hare-raising.Item.Rta3Rh4XASy8Ogaa]{bone cage} spell (see page 22) with a range of self (30-foot-radius sphere). After it uses this action, it can’t do so again until its tamer finishes a long rest.

Sizes Temporary Hit Points Gained

  • Small [[/r 1d6+1]]
  • Medium [[/r 1d8+2]]
  • Large [[/r 1d10+5]]
  • Huge [[/r 1d12+12]]
  • Gargantuan [[/r 1d20+25]]

cR23GfidZE1mUAGE.name: Grasping Bonetide II (Dire Bunny)
cR23GfidZE1mUAGE.description:
Prerequisite: 13th-level tamer, Grasping Bonetide I

Type: Passive (companion)

The damage of the dire bunny’s Grasping Bonetide action increases to 24 (7d6), and the size of the area increases to a 50-foot cone or a 20-foot-radius circle. The dire bunny gains a +1 bonus to the save DC of this action.

When the dire bunny’s tamer reaches 17th level in the tamer class, the damage of this action increases to 35 (10d6).

djqJx3Jef83xuy6D.name: Zone of Retributive Truth (Dire Bunny)
djqJx3Jef83xuy6D.description:
Prerequisite: 9th-level tamer, Veracious Question

Type: Active (bonus action)

As a bonus action, the dire bunny manifests an aura that lasts for 1 minute and extends 20 feet from the dire bunny, moving with it. As part of the bonus action to create the aura and as a bonus action on subsequent turns, the dire bunny can ask one creature it can see within the aura a question. If the creature can hear (or otherwise perceive) the question and understands it, it feels compelled to answer truthfully. If it doesn’t answer before the end of its next turn, or answers untruthfully, it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be thrown up to 20 feet in a direction of the dire bunny’s choice.

After the dire bunny has manifested this aura, it can’t do so again until its tamer finishes a short or long rest.

Bone Cage.name: Bone Cage
Bone Cage.description:
You draw the bones from all corpses within range, forming a carapace of ribcages and femurs. You gain temporary hit points for each Small or larger corpse wholly or partly within range, according to its size:

Sizes Temporary Hit Points Gained

  • Small [[/r 1d6+1]]
  • Medium [[/r 1d8+2]]
  • Large [[/r 1d10+5]]
  • Huge [[/r 1d12+12]]
  • Gargantuan [[/r 1d20+25]]

As an action on a subsequent turn you can cause your armour of bones to erupt, expending all remaining temporary hit points. Each other creature within range must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking piercing damage equal to your expended temporary hit points on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. Whatever the manner in which the temporary hit points are lost, the bones shatter and cannot be used in this way again.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the range of this spell increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 5th.

Class: Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Warlock, Wizard

materials.value: the bones of at least one non-animated corpse, which the spell consumes

gYDdFBY4JkD6Mcbh.name: Bone Cage
gYDdFBY4JkD6Mcbh.description:
Class: Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Warlock, Wizard

You draw the bones from all corpses within range, forming a carapace of ribcages and femurs. You gain temporary hit points for each Small or larger corpse wholly or partly within range, according to its size:

Sizes Temporary Hit Points Gained

  • Small [[/r 1d6+1]]
  • Medium [[/r 1d8+2]]
  • Large [[/r 1d10+5]]
  • Huge [[/r 1d12+12]]
  • Gargantuan [[/r 1d20+25]]

As an action on a subsequent turn you can cause your armour of bones to erupt, expending all remaining temporary hit points. Each other creature within range must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking piercing damage equal to your expended temporary hit points on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. Whatever the manner in which the temporary hit points are lost, the bones shatter and cannot be used in this way again.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the range of this spell increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 5th.

Foundry Note

This spell is set to heal for 1 hit point. When you cast it, add in the formulas for however many corpses are in range into the situational bonus area - 1. For example if there are 2 small corpses and 1 large corpse in range you would add into the roll 2d6 + 1 + 1d10 + 5 for the temp hp. Also note there is no damage set in the dexterity saving throw, you will need to do that manually as there is no way to know exactly how much temp hp you will have at the time.

materials.value: the bones of at least one non-animated corpse, which the spell consumes

Mi! (Dire Bunny).name: Mi! (Dire Bunny)
Mi! (Dire Bunny).description:
Prerequisite: 3rd-level tamer

Type: Active (action)

As an action, the dire bunny proclaims “Mi!” at one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can hear the proclamation, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 4 (1d8) thunder damage and 4 (1d8) psychic damage, and become frightened of the dire bunny until the end of the dire bunny’s next turn.

Braised Berry Bunny (Uncommon).name: Braised Berry Bunny (Uncommon)
Braised Berry Bunny (Uncommon).description:
At any time while you are under the influence of this magical meal’s effects, you can expend 1 charge to imbue your words with the power of veracity when you ask a creature a question. The creature must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be unable to speak a deliberate lie for the next minute.

You know whether the creature succeeds or fails on its saving throw. An affected creature is aware of the spell and can thus avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive in its answers as long as it remains within the boundaries of the truth.

Type: Active (action)

Skeletal limbs burst out from surfaces in the area, slashing and grasping at creatures in contact with those surfaces. Each of those creatures must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) slashing damage and becoming &reference[restrained] until the end of the dire bunny’s next turn on a failure, or taking half as much damage and not becoming restrained on a success. th21R166NiwPccOw.description:
Prerequisite: 3rd-level tamer

Type: Active (bonus action), Passive (companion & tamer)

The dire bunny gains proficiency in the Persuasion and Intimidation skills and, while the bunny is summoned, its tamer can add half its proficiency bonus to ability checks it makes that use the Insight, Intimidation, or Persuasion skills.

In addition, when the dire bunny asks a question, it can use a bonus action to imbue the question with magical truth. If the question’s recipient can hear (or otherwise perceive) and understand the question, it must make a Charisma saving throw, blurting out a short, truthful answer on a failure, or answering as it pleases (if at all) on a success. Field of Bones.name: Field of Bones
Field of Bones.description:
The ground in a 100-foot radius circle centred on a point you can see within range is punctured as bony claws, tails, and maws protrude from the ground, snapping, grasping, and raking at all within reach. The ground becomes difficult terrain for creatures other than you. A creature that starts its turn in this area or enters this area for the first time on its turn must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, it takes 6d6 slashing damage and is grappled by the bony protrusions (escape DC equals your spell save DC). On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn’t grappled.

For the duration of the spell, at the start of each of your turns, you can cause 1d4 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.nU8GN8La8DCt8SDb]{skeletons} to burst from the ground at points you choose within the spell’s area. On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command all the creatures made by this spell if the creature is within 500 feet of you, issuing the same command to each one. You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete. When the spell ends, all creatures created by this spell crumble into dust.

If this spell is cast in an area with a lot of buried corpses (GM’s discretion), like a graveyard or battlefield, the saving throw is made with disadvantage and you create 2d4 skeletons instead.

Class: Cleric, Warlock, Wizard

If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete. When the spell ends, all creatures created by this spell crumble into dust.

If this spell is cast in an area with a lot of buried corpses (GM’s discretion), like a graveyard or battlefield, the saving throw is made with &reference[disadvantage]{disadvantage} and you create [[/r 2d4]] skeletons instead.

affects.special: points you choose within the spell's area

Braised Berry Bunny (Legendary).name: Braised Berry Bunny (Legendary)
Braised Berry Bunny (Legendary).description:
At any time while you are under the influence of this magical meal’s effects, you can expend 1 charge to imbue your words with the power of veracity when you ask a creature a question. The creature must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be unable to speak a deliberate lie for the next minute.

You know whether the creature succeeds or fails on its saving throw. An affected creature is aware of the spell and can thus avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive in its answers as long as it remains within the boundaries of the truth.
